intro: Asta schaffneri subsp. pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's asta, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. The subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
